title: Who were the most valuable players in the NFL this season? Let's stack the top 100
content: We took the MVP conversation beyond Drake Maye vs. Matthew Stafford ... way beyond. Here are the 100 top players of the 2025 season.

title: Sources: Bucs tab ex-Falcon Robinson for OC job
content: The Buccaneers are finalizing a deal to hire former Falcons offensive coordinator Zac Robinson as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: 'What was that for?' Osaka asks of terse Cirstea
content: Naomi Osaka received a cool response from Sorana Cirstea after their second-round Australian Open match. Osaka said Cirstea was apparently upset with Osaka's efforts to pump herself up during the match.

title: McCaffrey, 4 QBs named AP NFL MVP finalists
content: Christian McCaffrey is the first player to be a finalist for three AP NFL awards in the same year, joining Josh Allen, Trevor Lawrence, Drake Maye and Matthew Stafford in the running for The Associated Press 2025 NFL Most Valuable Player award.

title: Vonn, Kim on Olympic team; Anderson falls short
content: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Jamie Anderson was notably absent from a U.S. Ski & Snowboard roster that was headlined by Olympic veterans Lindsey Vonn, Mikaela Shiffrin and Chloe Kim.

title: GM Lynch: Aiyuk has played last snap for 49ers
content: At Wednesday's end-of-season news conference, 49ers general manager John Lynch confirmed what has been obvious for months: WR Brandon Aiyuk will not return to the only NFL team he has ever known.

title: Niners' injury probe includes looking into substation
content: Niners GM John Lynch said the team will look into "everything" to find out why injuries continue to pile up year after year, including an investigation into the viral electrical substation conspiracy theory.

title: Mets strike again, add ace Peralta from Brewers
content: The Mets' winterlong pursuit of a front-line starting pitcher ended with them acquiring All-Star Freddy Peralta and right-hander Tobias Myers from the Brewers for prospects Brandon Sproat and Jett Williams.

title: Giannis cites chemistry, selfish play after routs
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo says chemistry issues might be contributing to the Bucks' recent penchant for lopsided losses.

content: Where will national title game standouts Fernando Mendoza and Akheem Mesidor land in Round 1? And could we really see six WRs in the opening 32 picks?

content: Wetzel: The NCAA needs Congress to give it a skinny exemption to at least set some eligibility standards.

content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

content: Puka Nacua's elite performance can be attributed to the mentorship of veteran receivers Cooper Kupp and Davante Adams.

content: From underrated to perhaps the best hoops player in the country, Mikayla Blakes is just getting started.

content: The 22-year-old center is slated to make his return Thursday to a team still fighting to get in the playoff mix.

content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

content: Steve Kerr and Steve Nash own Mallorca with a former USMNT international and an ex-tennis pro. What has it taught them about sport, leadership and life?

content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Cooper Flagg, Jalen Green, Jonathan Kuminga and more.

title: UFC 324 expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: Who has the edge in the first UFC event of 2026? Four former UFC fighters make their picks for the UFC 324 main event.

title: MMA Rank 50-1: Which stars could shine the brightest in 2026?
content: Makhachev, Topruia or Chimaev? ESPN ranks the top 50 fighters in MMA based on how they will perform in 2026.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea want Dortmund's Felix Nmecha
content: Dortmund midfielder Felix Nmecha is attracting interest from Manchester United and Chelsea. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'Europe looks lost': Zelenskyy says Ukraine can defend Greenland; why he mentioned Groundhog Day
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy criticized Europe's delayed response to security threats at the World Economic Forum, lamenting a lack of decisive action and a failure to build its own defense capabilities. He contrasted this with perceived US action, questioning Europe's will to pursue justice and hold Russia accountable for its war

title: RCB sale: Adar Poonawalla to place 'strong bid'; confirms plan to buy IPL franchise
content: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla is preparing a strong bid to acquire the Indian Premier League's Royal Challengers Bengaluru franchise. This follows Diageo's decision to put RCB up for sale after their maiden IPL title win in 2025. The franchise, a fan favorite, has a rich history and has seen legendary players grace its ranks.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands in the US; ‚ÄòLeader‚Äô roles added
content: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization drive influenced by AI. The consulting giant aims to better align roles with evolving client demands and employee career aspirations. New senior leadership designations will also be introduced, promising greater clarity and market relevance across all divisions.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; ‚ÄòMaybe he‚Äôs realised what everyone is worried about‚Äô
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: ‚ÄòMaduro in jail, but not Putin‚Äô: Zelenskyy suggests Russian president should be arrested
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy contrasted Venezuelan leader Maduro's trial with Russian President Putin's freedom, questioning why the instigator of a major European war remains at large. Zelenskyy's remarks, made at the World Economic Forum, followed Putin's suggestion to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's reconstruction and a Gaza ceasefire plan.

title: Trump unveils 'Board of Peace': India absent from stage; Pak's Shehbaz Sharif joins US Prez
content: Former US President Donald Trump launched his "Board of Peace" initiative at the World Economic Forum in Davos. India received an invitation to join this effort aimed at resolving global conflicts. However, India was not present on the stage during the unveiling. Several countries, including some from the Middle East and Asia, were listed as participants in the initiative.

title: 'Meeting was good': Trump after talks with Zelenskyy in Davos; has a message for Putin
content: US President Donald Trump met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Davos, stating the talks went well. Trump conveyed a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin, urging an end to the war, which has resulted in significant casualties. Despite previous efforts, no major progress has been made in resolving the conflict.

title: Jensen Huang's Davos Prediction: AI buildout to boost trade jobs; $7tn push drives pay surge
content: AI's growth is set to create a massive demand for skilled trades. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang forecasts a boom in jobs like electricians and plumbers. These roles, crucial for building AI data centers, could become six-figure careers. This infrastructure buildout is described as the largest in history. Experts believe there will be a significant shortage of these essential workers.

title: Oscar 2026: Sinners sets new record with 16 nominations; Homebound out of race
content: As the Oscar 2026 nominations draw near, the competition is fierce, celebrating the finest films of 2025. Get ready for an exhilarating showdown for Best Picture, Best Director, and the coveted acting honors. The glamorous 98th Academy Awards will take place at the iconic Dolby Theatre on March 15th, with the hilarious Conan O'Brien back to host the evening.

title: T20 WC row: 'Concerned' Bangladesh says Mustafizur IPL snub sparked standoff
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board president Aminul Islam Bulbul has revealed that Mustafizur Rahman‚Äôs removal from an IPL team over security concerns triggered Bangladesh‚Äôs hardening stance against travelling to India for the T20 World Cup.

title: Geoffrey Hinton's AI warning: AI Godfather warns of existential risks; urges urgent global action
content: AI pioneer Geoffrey Hinton issues a stark warning: humanity's greatest error would be neglecting research into coexisting with advanced intelligent systems. He fears unchecked AI could lead to our extinction, lamenting the world's insufficient seriousness regarding these profound risks. Hinton stresses an urgent need for research to ensure peaceful coexistence as AI rapidly approaches and surpasses human intelligence.

title: How can Budget 2026 insulate India‚Äôs growth story from Trump‚Äôs tariff war?
content: What can Union Budget 2026 do to help India deal with the negative impact of Trump‚Äôs tariff policies? Times of India Online asked economists and experts and here‚Äôs what they had to say:

title: 'Security risk situation has not changed': B'desh says no T20 WC matches in India
content: Bangladesh has reiterated that its refusal to play the upcoming World Cup in India is solely due to security concerns and is a sovereign decision. Government adviser Professor Asif Nazrul criticised the ICC for failing to address Bangladesh‚Äôs grievances, while BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul confirmed the board‚Äôs demand for a neutral venue, insisting the team is ready to play.

title: Gracie Hunt hints at how she‚Äôs coping with Chiefs‚Äô tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team‚Äôs side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: Former Kadokawa chairman suspended, sentenced in Tokyo Olympics bribery case
content: Former Kadokawa Corp. chairman Tsuguhiko Kadokawa received a suspended prison sentence for approving illegal payments to a Tokyo Olympic official. The bribery aimed to secure sponsorship for his company, contributing to a wider corruption scandal that tarnished the global sporting event's image. Kadokawa denies wrongdoing and plans to appeal the ruling.

title: MrBeast warns fans that slow photo requests can become dangerous in seconds
content: MrBeast says taking photos with fans in public can quickly spiral into chaos if not done fast. He explained that slow photo requests draw attention, form crowds, and ruin outings. To avoid being mobbed, he takes the phone himself, snaps the picture instantly, and leaves, stressing that speed is essential despite his appreciation for fans.

title: Maverick Macron vs Top Gun Trump: French president's shades stole the show
content: In the thin Alpine air, amid the annual earnestness of the World Economic Forum, Macron looked less like a central banker and more like a man who had wandered in from a fighter jet. The memes followed instantly. Europe‚Äôs philosopher-king, suddenly recast as Maverick.

title: Can rosemary oil help regrow lost hairs? What science says
content: Hair loss drives millions toward natural fixes, and rosemary oil has emerged as a viral favorite. Fueled by TikTok testimonials and traditional wisdom, the remedy sounds promising. But behind the hype lies a complex mix of biology, limited research, and expert caution that challenges simple answers.

title: Delhi excise policy probe: Court acquits Arvind Kejriwal in ED summons case
content: A Delhi court has acquitted former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in two cases filed by the Enforcement Directorate. These cases stemmed from his failure to appear before the agency in connection with the Delhi excise policy probe. The ED had sought action against Kejriwal for not complying with multiple summons issued under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: 'Running beautifully': Trump says 'Board of Peace' has started work
content: President Trump unveiled his "Board of Peace" at Davos, a $1 billion initiative aimed at resolving international conflicts.  While many nations, particularly from the Middle East, have confirmed participation, key allies like Britain have expressed doubts.  The announcement follows Trump's frustration over not receiving the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: MLB trade rumors: Phillies target $7.7mn Red Sox OF for 2026 shakeup
content: Philadelphia Phillies are reportedly eyeing Boston Red Sox outfielder Jarren Duran to bolster their struggling outfield for the 2026 season. Duran offers much-needed speed, defense, and consistent offense, fitting Philadelphia's immediate needs. A potential trade involving Alec Bohm and prospects could reshape both teams, addressing Philadelphia's outfield woes while providing Boston with key pieces.

title: PCB investigates financial scam involving Babar, Rizwan; losses could exceed millions
content: Several prominent Pakistani cricketers, including Babar Azam and Shaheen Shah Afridi, are reportedly victims of a massive financial scam. A businessman, who had sponsored PSL franchises, allegedly fled the country after promising profits that never materialized. Players, who invested personal and family funds, now face losing millions, with total investments potentially exceeding one billion rupees.

title: Delhi-NCR air pollution: GRAP Stage-III curbs revoked; quality likely to stay moderate to poor
content: Air quality in Delhi-NCR has improved significantly. The Commission for Air Quality Management has lifted Stage-III restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan. This means some construction and demolition activities can resume. However, measures under Stage-I and Stage-II remain in effect. Citizens are urged to follow guidelines to maintain better air quality.

title: MBBS counselling halted at SMVD Medical College: Is education being sacrificed for politics?
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Board of Professional Entrance Examinations (BOPEE) has refused fresh MBBS counselling for Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence students, leaving the allocation of supernumerary seats to the government. Following the National Medical Commission‚Äôs withdrawal of the college‚Äôs permission for regulatory non-compliance, students now face uncertainty, caught between administrative inaction, political agitation, and questions over merit and accountability.

title: 'Taken up strongly‚Äô: Trespassing and vandalism at Indian embassy in Croatia‚Äî what MEA said
content: India has strongly condemned the trespassing and vandalism at its embassy in Zagreb, Croatia, by anti-India elements. The Ministry of External Affairs has urged Croatian authorities to hold the perpetrators accountable, emphasising the inviolability of diplomatic premises under the Vienna Convention. This incident follows a similar event at the Indian Consulate in Seattle last year.

title: India, Australia beware! Pakistan tipped as dark horse for U19 WC title win
content: While India and Australia are favoured for the 2026 ICC Under-19 World Cup, former South Africa spinner Paul Adams highlights Pakistan as a strong contender. Pakistan's recent Under-19 Asia Cup triumph, where they convincingly defeated India, signals their formidable presence and potential to challenge traditional powerhouses in the tournament.

title: 'Industry & values have changed': Jaaved Jaaferi reacts to AR Rahman‚Äôs remarks
content: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi, promoting 'Mayasabha', reflected on industry shifts, noting Gen Z's six-second attention span impacts content creation. He linked this to changing values and the business of making projects, not just films. Jaaferi's comments followed AR Rahman's remarks about potential communal bias and power changes affecting his work in Bollywood.

title: Dog-walking row behind him: IAS officer Khirwar returns as MCD chief; strays now his ‚Äòpet project‚Äô
content: Sanjeev Khirwar, a 1994-batch IAS officer, has been appointed the new municipal commissioner of Delhi, over three years after a controversy led to his transfer out of the capital. He was previously moved following allegations of forcing athletes to end training early at Thyagraj Stadium for his dog walks.

title: Noida techie death case: Police arrest 2 more builders; probe widens
content: Two more builders were arrested in Noida following the tragic death of software engineer Yuvraj Mehta, whose car fell into an unbarricaded, water-filled construction pit. A harrowing video shows Mehta desperately signaling for help with his phone's torch for nearly 90 minutes as a crowd watched helplessly.

title: Mumbai, Pune to get woman mayors: Reservation breakup for 29 corporations in state ‚Äî who gets what
content: Maharashtra's urban development department held its annual lottery, reserving mayoral posts in 29 municipal corporations.  Nine of the 16 reserved seats are for women, ensuring representation for Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, Other Backward Classes, and the General category. Key cities like Mumbai, Pune, and Nagpur will see women mayors from the General category, while others have specific caste-based reservations.

title: Greenland: Nato chief says talks to focus on keeping Russia, China out
content: Nato chief Mark Rutte revealed that discussions with the US concerning Greenland will prioritize blocking Russian and Chinese military or economic influence in the Danish Arctic territory. This follows President Trump's recent softening of earlier acquisition threats, indicating a "framework" for a deal has been reached.  Allies, especially Arctic members, aim to secure the region.

title: 'Chup chaap ball daal': Rohit Sharma's 'appeal' warning to India spinner
content: Rohit Sharma lauded Tilak Varma's composure and big-match temperament, highlighting his potential for the T20 World Cup. Sharma also humorously advised Kuldeep Yadav to focus on bowling rather than appealing excessively. Both players are crucial for India's title defense campaign.

title: Honour killing in Moradabad? Couple thrashed to death; girl's brother held
content: Bodies of a 24-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman from different communities, who had been missing for three days, were discovered in Moradabad district. Police suspect honour killing, with the woman's brothers arrested for allegedly killing the couple and burying their bodies near a temple.

title: Is Fortnite down? V39.30 update, maintenance schedule and more
content: Fortnite players, get ready for the v39.30 update arriving January 22, 2026. Servers will be down for maintenance starting 4 AM ET. This essential downtime allows for new content and game improvements. Expect to resume playing the popular battle royale game around 6 AM ET. Follow @FortniteStatus for real-time updates on the maintenance progress.

title: 9 deaths, 2 years, 1 campus: Why IIT Kanpur tops India‚Äôs IIT suicide toll
content: A recent suicide at IIT Kanpur highlights a severe mental health crisis in premier technical institutes, with the campus accounting for nearly 30% of IIT student deaths in two years. Alumni and faculty point to systemic failures, intense competition, and missed warning signs, urging accountability from the Union education ministry.

title: "1st Victory, Divine Prelude": Actor Vijay On Whistle Symbol For His Party
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay today welcomed the Election Commission's allotment of the whistle as his party's official election symbol, calling it TVK's "first victory" and a "divine prelude" to electoral success.

title: "I'm Victim Of Gandhi Siblings' Rift": Himanta Sarma's Bombshell In Davos
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has alleged cracks between the Gandhi siblings, ripping into the top Gandhi family members during his Davos debut.

title: Told IndiGo To Dismiss Senior Vice President: Centre To Delhi High Court
content: The government today told the Delhi High Court that it asked IndiGo to dismiss its senior vice president following the massive disruption in flights in December last year due to inefficient planning.

title: Girl, 11, Raped In Delhi, Left In Forest Area By E-Rickshaw Driver: Cops
content: An 11-year-old girl, selling roses at traffic signals in central Delhi, was kidnapped, raped and left unconscious in a forest area by an e-rickshaw driver, police said on Thursday.

title: Explained: What In Governor's Speech Sparked Karnataka Assembly Storm
content: A showdown between the Karnataka government and the governor erupted on the floor of the assembly on Wednesday after Governor Thawarchand Gehlot walked out without reading the inaugural speech.

title: 10 Army Personnel Killed, 10 Injured As Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In J&K's Doda
content: Ten army personnel were killed and ten others injured when their vehicle skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda on Thursday, officials said.

title: Delhi Cops Act On Social Media Tip, Save Man From Suicide At Railway Station
content: Swift action by the Delhi Police Social Media Control Room helped save the life of a 19-year-old youth who had allegedly expressed his intention to commit suicide at a railway station after posting distress messages online, police said.

title: Odisha Pastor Assaulted, Forced To Drink Drain Water By Right-Wing Group
content: A Christian pastor in Odisha's Dhenkanal district was allegedly assaulted and humiliated by a group accused of links to right-wing organisations, following claims that he was involved in religious conversions.

title: Dog Missing In Spanish Train Crash Rescued After Four Days
content: Firefighters in southern Spain rescued Boro, a dog missing since Sunday's high-speed train crash, reuniting him with his owners in a rare moment of relief amid national mourning for at least 43 people killed.

title: 'I Am A Dictator, Sometimes You Need One': Trump After Davos Speech
content: Speaking after his address at the World Economic Forum in Davos, US President Donald Trump likened himself to a "dictator."

title: 19-Year-Old Dies By Suicide In Classroom Of Private College In Gujarat
content: A 19-year-old student died by suicide after hanging herself inside the college classroom in Gujarat's Gandhinagar district on Wednesday.

title: Russia Jails Schoolgirl For 4 Years For Posters Of Pro-Kyiv Fighters
content: A Russian court upheld a four-year prison term for a 17-year-old girl who hung posters of pro-Ukraine Russian fighters in her school, Russian independent media reported.

title: "Mega Corruption, Poor Governance": Jagan Reddy Slams Andhra Government
content: YSR Congress Party chief YS Jagan Mohan Reddy launched a strong attack on the Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu-led government, accusing it of "mega corruption" and poor governance.

title: Explained: Greenland's Role In Nuclear Defense And Trump's 'Golden Dome'
content: In a hypothetical nuclear war involving Russia, China and the United States, the island of Greenland would be in the middle of Armageddon.

title: What We Know About Trump's Greenland 'Framework' Deal
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a framework for a permanent deal over Greenland, backing off his threat to seize the territory from Denmark -- but offered no details.

title: 2-Month-Old Puppy Sexually Assaulted, Thrashed By Man In Mumbai: Police
content: A 20-year-old man was booked in Malad in north Mumbai for allegedly sexually assaulting a two-month-old puppy and thrashing it, a police official said on Thursday.

title: Scrap Dealer Among 4 Arrested For Armed Robbery Of Rs 40 Lakh In Delhi: Cops
content: Four men, including a scrap dealer, were arrested for allegedly orchestrating an armed robbery of Rs 40 lakh in Delhi's Shahbad Dairy area, police said on Thursday.

title: 15 Maoists, Including Top Leader With Rs 1 Crore Bounty, Killed in Jharkhand
content: Fifteen Maoists, including top leader Anal Da who was carrying a bounty of Rs 1 crore on his head, were killed in a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district on Thursday, police said.

title: Uttar Pradesh voters may get to skip SIR hearings, send representatives instead
content: Voters would have the option of uploading their documents on EC website and then send their representative with an authorisation letter, which can include local booth level agents (BLAs) appointed by political parties; an order to this effect might be issued this week, as per sources

title: Chilli, palm oil fetch record prices this season, says Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu
content: Crop diversification by farmers and proactive government measures have resulted in steady and remunerative prices, he says

title: IndiGo flight disruptions: Delhi High Court asks IndiGo to file affidavit on refund, compensation
content: The counsel for the low-cost air carrier told a Bench of Chief Justice D.K. Upadhyaya and Justice Tejas Karia that refund for the cancelled flights had been processed, and compensation was also being offered in terms of the civil aviation requirements for cancellation of flights

title: Lokesh, Revanth stress cooperative approach for Telugu States‚Äô development
content: They discuss education reforms, IT development, and skill-building initiatives in the two States, on the sidelines of  Davos meet

title: Speaker at UoH faces student backlash for ‚Äòhomosexuality is unnatural‚Äô comment
content: "I stand by what I said. You may disagree," says renowned author and Nari Shakti Puraskar recipient Neerja Madhav

title: Kisan drone service now accessible through mobile app, says agriculture official
content: It marks a major step in the digital transformation of agriculture, says Agriculture Director Manazir Jeelani Samoon

title: Kozhikode Corporation‚Äôs Re-VERSE drive urges plastic-free practices at KLF
content: ‚ÄãAs part of the campaign, Mayor urges visitors to avoid single-use plastic bottles and carry steel water bottles, reusable cups and towels

title: Watch: The Amit Shah playbook: Rebuilding NDA in Tamil Nadu | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: In election-bound Tamil Nadu, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has pulled off what many thought was unthinkable‚Äîbringing together sworn rivals, the AIADMK and its splinter group, the AMMK. In doing so, he has not only rebuilt a fractured NDA in Tamil Nadu but also strengthened it ahead of the elections. How did this happen?

title: Modi should explain Indore tragedy: Binoy Viswam
content: In an open letter to the Prime Minister, the CPI  State secretary  says Modi should explain how the man-made tragedy was allowed to happen at Indore in Madhya Pradesh, where a ‚Äòtriple-engine administration‚Äô is in power

title: Pilgrim killed in leopard attack at M.M. Hills; ‚Çπ5 lakh relief given
content: In the aftermath of the incident, authorities have suspended the padayatra and the movement of two-wheelers in the M.M. Hills region till January 24 as a precautionary measure

title: Strike disrupts private bus services in Vadakara
content: The strike was called by a section of bus operators in Kozhikode, protesting the delay in the arrest of a suspect involved in the attack on a conductor on the Vadakara‚ÄìThottilpalam route

title: Nirmala Lakshman recalls Periyar‚Äôs contribution to Vaikom Satyagraha
content: Ms. Lakshman, the author of The Tamils: A Portrait of a Community, said Periyar felt deeper issues needed to be addressed.

title: IAF‚Äôs ‚ÄòSindoor‚Äô formation to lead Republic Day flypast
content: The flypast will carry the flag of Operation Sindoor, commemorating India‚Äôs decisive military response from May 7 to May 10 following the Pahalgam terror attack

title: SCTIMST unveils wound dressing of animal origin
content: CholeDerm is made from the gall bladder of farm animals and as per the institute, is the world‚Äôs first graft scaffold of animal origin for accelerated wound healing

title: SNDP Yogam-NSS unity driven by selfish political interests, alleges SNDP Samrakshana Samiti
content: Samiti leaders ask the two organisations to clarify their positions on caste census and other key issues

title: Over 500 participate in Apprenticeship and Placement Drive in Hubballi
content: KLE Technological University organised it in collaboration with the Union Ministry of Education and the State Department of Technical Education

title: Hike in tax on unmanufactured tobacco: Tobacco traders to stay off auction platforms in Karnataka from Jan. 24
content: The Indian Tobacco Association, in a letter to the Executive Director of Tobacco Board, Guntur, has shared its concern over the reported recent imposition of central excise duty at 18% and GST ranging from 28% to 40% on unmanufactured tobacco

title: Jagan accuses NDA of falsely claiming credit for land resurvey during YSRCP regime
content: It was a promise made in YSRCP election manifesto in 2019 and implemented in December 2020, says former CM

title: Forest fire continues in Sikkim's Pangolakha Wildlife Sanctuary near Indo-China border
content: The fire, which broke out on January 20, has already affected nearly 12 hectares of forest land, conservator of forests (Wildlife), Udai Gurung said

title: Rebate scheme for traffic fines in Karnataka swells revenue, at cost of road safety
content: Rebate schemes embolden violators, especially during peak hours when pedestrian movement is high, say police

title: Forest department appeals against order to handover three elephants to Kanchi Kamakoti Peetam
content: The writ appeal has been listed for hearing before Madras High Court Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan

title: Memorial for Vaikom Muhammad Basheer to be opened in Beypore on January 24
content: The memorial will serve as a platform for art performances, readings and discussions on the late writer‚Äôs works, says Minister for Tourism and Public Works

title: Konthuruthy residents at their wits‚Äô end
content: As many as 126 families living on the banks of the Konthuruthy river, a puramboke holding in revenue records, in Kochi for years together are staring at uncertainty as the Kerala High Court has ordered eviction of all encroachments.  M.P. Praveen talks to some of the residents of the area, listening to their grievances and demands

title: Man dies recording reels while on tractor during farm work in Mahagaon
content: The deceased was identified as 22-year-old Lokesh Kallappa Poojari, a resident of the village in Kamalapur taluk of Kalaburagi

title: MCCI bats for Mysuru-Kushalnagar railway project
content: The construction of the project and its subsequent operations will create direct and indirect employment opportunities for local youth, MCCI president K.B. Lingaraju says

title: JD(S) leader sees no transparency in PMAY house allotment in Dharwad
content: Hubballi-Dharwad West MLA Arvind Bellad accused of allotting 1,179 houses at Lakamanahalli to his followers and their acquaintances

title: Police solve Dharwad woman‚Äôs murder by arresting her fianc√©

title: Raise concerns over A.P.'s ‚Äòworsening law and order' in Parliament, Jagan tells YSRCP MPs
content: Party chief wants them to use Parliament as a strong platform to highlight the problems faced by farmers, youth, women, workers and weaker sections in the State

title: Though court dismisses government claim on Cheruvally estate, it says Ayana Trust ownership not indisputable
content: State‚Äôs primary contention was that Cheruvally estate is recorded as Pandaravakapattom in 1910 Settlement Register, considered a fundamental document for determining property‚Äôs original character. However, court held that Settlement Register alone cannot be treated as conclusive proof of continuing government ownership

title: CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby wins cross-party support after plate-washing video sparks trolls
content: Leaders across party lines defend CPI(M) general secretary, calling the act a matter of habit and a rejection of feudal attitudes

title: Tourism push to turn Devikulam into wedding, conference destination
content: State plans conference halls and guest facilities to ease pressure on Munnar and attract high-value visitors.

title: Three killed, 14 injured as bus collides with lorry in Nandyal of A.P.
content: The bus driver lost control over the wheels after the front right tyre burst and rammed the vehicle into a lorry on the otherside of the road

title: Watch: Uttar Pradesh SIR: Why were so many voters deleted?
content: The post SIR draft voters list of the Uttar Pradesh was published on January 6 after a 62 day process of enumeration by BLOs. A whopping 2.89 crore names have been deleted in the 2025 electoral rolls of UP. Who are these voters whose names have been deleted in India‚Äôs largest State? The Hindu‚Äôs Sreeparna Chakrabarty traveled across UP to find out more.

title: AI to help check genuineness of farm data in A.P.

title: Press Club of India criticises J&K Police over ‚Äòoral summons‚Äô to journalists
content: The PCI flags that such arbitrary actions create an atmosphere of fear. Stating that a reporter had to spend 15 hours in police station over four days and was told to sign a bond that he would not ‚Äòdisturb the peace‚Äô, the Press Club says it indicated the harassment being unleased on journalists in the region.
